image.altText: SANFL and Australian rules football legend Barrie Robran.

props.synopsis: Australian rules football champion and Hall of Fame legend Barrie Robran is being remembered as "an icon, a mentor, and a true gentleman" following his death at the age of 77.

title.children: Football legend Barrie Robran remembered as an 'icon' and a 'gentleman'

image.altText: A man with a long white beard wearing a beanie sits in front of a window with a serious expression

props.synopsis: Ngarrindjeri Elder Uncle Major 'Moogy' Sumner says he is worried an Indigenous man inside South Australia's high-security prison could become "another death in custody", following claims he has self-harmed multiple times while behind bars. WARNING: This story contains reference to self-harm and suicide.

title.children: Elder warns Indigenous man in high-security prison is in 'dire situation'

image.altText: A pig with a dark background behind it.

props.synopsis: Footage taken by an activist group allegedly in a piggery north of Adelaide shows pigs feeding on carcasses, some belonging to other pigs. WARNING: this story contains graphic content that may distress readers.

title.children: Cannibalism footage sparks animal welfare investigation at SA piggery

image.altText: An Australian border force officer in uniform holds a box of vapes in gold packaging

props.synopsis: Almost half a billon dollars worth of vapes have been taken off the street since new laws came into force 18 months ago as research shows fewer young Australians are taking up vaping.

title.children: More than 10 million vapes seized since 2024 import ban

image.altText: A man pours red wine into a glass on a table set with cutlery and a napkins.

props.synopsis: Australia crushed more red wine grapes this year but fewer people are drinking it, prompting warnings of a worsening wine glut.

title.children: Australia's red wine glut likely to get worse

image.altText: Bradley John Murdoch wears a collared shirt as he is escorted by police.

props.synopsis: The lead investigator of the 2001 murder of British backpacker Peter Falconio says she is "not surprised, but disappointed" Bradley John Murdoch never revealed the location of his remains.

title.children: Police say Peter Falconio's family denied closure after killer Bradley Murdoch dies

image.altText: Woman sits in a chair in a psychologist's office as they show her something on a clipboard.

props.synopsis: A number of states have indicated they will soon allow GPs to diagnose ADHD, but doctors warn patients may still face out-of-pocket costs or have difficulty accessing prescriptions.

title.children: GPs set to diagnose ADHD, but say appointments unlikely to be bulk-billed

image.altText: Jase Burgoyne gets a handball away

props.synopsis: Port Adelaide's general manager says the references to sexual violence contained in racist messages to a Power player over the weekend have taken toxic trolling to "another level" — and he has also expressed concern that sports betting is exacerbating vitriol against players.

title.children: Power condemns 'vile' sexual violence threat contained in racist messages

image.altText: A woman with a scarf sitting in an armchair next to a cabinet with vases on top

props.synopsis: A South Australian woman who feared she might not make it while waiting for heart surgery has been told her life-saving procedure has been scheduled for next week.

title.children: Patient fears she will die waiting for pacemaker amid surgery delay

image.altText: A man in glasses and a suit outside glass doors

props.synopsis: A South Australian police officer injured in a shooting which killed Brevet Sergeant Jason Doig in 2023 has recounted the moment he held his dying colleague in his arms. Another officer shared her guilt for unknowingly leading her colleagues into "a nightmare".

title.children: Police officer describes moment he held dying colleague in his arms after ambush

image.altText: Large mounds of brown seaweed alongside pylons on a beach.

props.synopsis: The opening of Marion Bay's new $3.8 million boat ramp is marred by a host of safety complaints, with key groups now refusing to use it.

title.children: Fishers and Sea Rescue refuse to use new $3.8m boat ramp

image.altText: A person pointing to a passage in a children's book

props.synopsis: Children who experience domestic violence are often left without a voice. A new storybook written by ten children who have lived experience sheds a light on the profound impact of family violence. Warning: This story contains content that may cause distress for some readers.

title.children: 'Dad is like a tornado': Children capture domestic violence through storytelling

image.altText: A whale's tail peaking out of the surface of the water, with boats in the background in the harbour.

props.synopsis: Sydney ferry passengers on their morning commute were greeted by a humpback whale, which entered the harbour around 8am on Wednesday.

title.children: Whale spotted in Sydney Harbour, ferries paused on morning commute

image.altText: A man in a blue jumper and a a woman in a white and grey jumper, holding a red folder, standing in front of a grave.

props.synopsis: More than 160 years before Erin Patterson's mushroom murder trial, four SA children died after eating poisonous mushrooms.

title.children: Mushroom trial raises scars of 1861 poisoning that killed four children

image.altText: A snow-covered alpine landscape.

props.synopsis: The search was launched after aircraft, with one occupant aboard, failed to arrive at its destination on the state's Far South Coast.

title.children: Search underway for plane missing in Snowy Mountains

image.altText: Mark Zuckerberg, standing on a stage, wearing a black t-shirt, talking at a company conference.

props.synopsis: Meta shareholders are suing CEO Mark Zuckerberg, along with current and former executives, for more than $US8 billion ($12.2 billion) in fines and other costs following the Cambridge Analytica scandal.

title.children: Zuckerberg and former Meta execs sued for billions over user data

image.altText: A tight head shot of a young woman with red hair smiling while posing for a selfie.

props.synopsis: Police allege Chun Lai Yuen was driving a black Honda Civic at more than 90 kph when it struck teenager Caitlyn Dickson after a Perth car cruise event.

title.children: Chinese national granted bail after teen girl struck in high-speed crash

image.altText: Empty bed at Royal Brisbane and Women's Hospital

props.synopsis: Elective surgeries have been paused for 48 hours while resources are diverted to emergency departments.

title.children: Elective surgeries paused at major Qld hospitals 'overwhelmed' by flu cases

image.altText: A man in a suit.

props.synopsis: Jake Sullivan was found guilty of raping an Australian Defence Force Academy colleague in Canberra in 2022.

title.children: Suspended army officer cadet jailed for raping ADFA colleague

image.altText: A young girl staring blankly at a camera.

props.synopsis: It's a blank, expressionless look often given by the younger generation in service roles. But experts explain there is a reason why this trend is emerging.

title.children: The gen Z stare is going viral. Here's what it is

image.altText: U.S. President Donald Trump holds up a chart with numbers showing tax rates changed to trading partners

props.synopsis: Maybe the best way to comprehend just how genuinely chaotic these intersecting systems have become is to stop trying to think about them at a country-by-country level, and just pick a product: lobsters.

title.children: How lobsters hold the key to understanding Trump's trade chaos

image.altText: A chart tracks stock market lower

props.synopsis: The local share market pulled back after hitting fresh records yesterday, as investors sold off bank stocks.

title.children: Broad-based fall pulls ASX off record high as bank stocks drag — as it happened

image.altText: June looks to the right of the camera while wearing the white handmaid bonnet and red cape.

props.synopsis: From Elizabeth Moss's Handmaid's Tale snub to Adolescence breaking records, here's what you need to know about the 2025 Emmy nominations.

title.children: Elizabeth Moss snubbed for final Handmaid's Tale and other Emmy shocks

image.altText: An external view of the start strong childcare centre

props.synopsis: It is alleged the two workers both handled the toddler roughly on two separate occasions on the same day, causing significant bruising and injuries.

title.children: Two Sydney childcare workers charged with assault of toddler

image.altText: Hannah sitting in the sun smiling with a drink in hand.

props.synopsis: A jury hears the man accused of murdering his ex-partner told a friend she was already dead when he torched the car containing her body.

title.children: Lachlan Young told friend Hannah McGuire 'was suffocated', court hears

image.altText: The former manager of singer Guy Sebastian, Titus Day, outside court wearing a bl

props.synopsis: Guy Sebastian's former manager Titus Day was acquitted of four charges, but the jury was hung on the remaining 30.

title.children: Jury hung on raft of charges against Guy Sebastian's former manager

image.altText: Australia batter Sam Konstas looks back at his stumps as the cricket ball hits them.

props.synopsis: With the Ashes starting in four months, it doesn't feel like we know much more than we did a year ago about who should line up against England, with the David Warner chalice still poisoned.

title.children: The West Indies tour was supposed to show us the way forward — then it didn't

image.altText: A boy in a red shirt and cap stands on the rails at a sheep sale.

props.synopsis: Archie McMahon and his brother Freddie convinced their parents to feed up a pen of heavy lambs, and it has paid off with a national record price.

title.children: Young farmer succeeds in mission to break national lamb price record

image.altText: Ken Henry stands behind a black and wooden podium, looking down

props.synopsis: Australia's environment protection laws have both failed to stop the degradation of nature and also held back economic growth, former Treasury secretary Ken Henry warns.

title.children: Ken Henry calls for urgent environmental protection overhaul

image.altText: Two soldiers on the ground in camoflauge firing a Carl Gustaf weapon.

props.synopsis: This weapon that has been fired by decades of Australian soldiers may have been causing damage to their brains.

title.children: Watch what happens when ADF soldiers fire the Carl Gustaf recoilless rifle

image.altText: Donald Trump and Gianni Infantino in blue suits peering over the golden FIFA Club World Cup trophy on the Oval Office desk

props.synopsis: Despite FIFA's claims the Club World Cup was "a world-class stage", it faced significant challenges that could also impact the 2026 World Cup in a country governed by the uncertainty of Donald Trump.

title.children: Empty seats and big delays mean the World Cup may trouble Trump's USA

image.altText: A side-by-side image shows young German woman Carolina Wilga and Aboriginal man Clinton Lockyer

props.synopsis: The miraculous survival of German backpacker Carolina Wilga in the West Australian outback was met with joy and relief across the country. But for families of missing Aboriginal men who are still searching for answers, it's prompted uncomfortable questions.

title.children: Why do we care about some people who go missing, but ignore others?

image.altText: A player holds the ball above their head

props.synopsis: The Aussie Diamonds' 2025-26 contracts have been announced as we head towards the Super Netball semifinals, while one team is set for a major rebuild after losing its long-standing coach and captains.

title.children: Alice Teague-Neeld gets Diamonds' call-up after cracking Super Netball season

image.altText: Turia Pitt takes a selfie while walking

props.synopsis: Research shows, perhaps surprisingly, that women with young kids feel better about their bodies than women with no children.

title.children: How becoming a mum helped Turia Pitt appreciate her body
